title: Aaron Lohmann
text:
My name is Aaron Lohmann, I am a PhD candidate in economics at IfW Kiel and Bielefeld University. Deeply interested in empirical and theoretical economics research on aspects of the digital economy.
Download my CV here: Download CV

title: Bootstraps & Bandings
text:
Are the residential property bands of 3 decades ago becoming less so? Would a sample of those recently-sold reveal band convergence? And what may be inferred about those not sampled?
Over the years, urban properties have been added to and divided up. And two streets of equal attractiveness, and with equivalently-banded properties, may have diverged as neighbourhoods evolved.
Whilst properties can and do move to higher or lower bands following alteration, would a sample of those recently-sold reveal band convergence after so long? And what may be inferred about the wider housing stock?

title: Reading Course in Statistical Sciences
text: A reading course in statistical sciences held in the summer term of 2023 at university Bielefeld. Taking the wonderful book Causal Inference - The Mixtape by Scott Cunningham as a structuring guideline. Students had to present one method in each week and we discussed empirical papers applying these techniques all together.

title: QJE - PhD Reading Group
text:
Some person reading something smart. Credit: foto priscilladupreez
This reading group intends to discuss the current research in brought aspects of economics. It is designed from PhD students for PhD students. All PhD students in the field of economics are warmly invited. We discuss every two to three weeks one of the papers in the most recent issue of Quartely Journal of Economics. The scope of the reading group is intentionally brought to allow us doctoral students a wide understanding of economics instead of focusing narrowly on our own research topics.
Dates will follow shortly.
